intro: Ruehssia riparia, commonly known as the river ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in moist, shady environments near rivers and streams, making it a common sight in riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with appropriate moisture conditions.
